content.question: What is the area of the region enclosed by the graphs of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FFB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D26@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
